Here's an opportunity for us to picnic at this beautiful festival to:
- enjoy time together,
- share and remember in appreciation our family and friends who have journeyed on...

organized by Forest Hills Educational Trust
http://www.foresthill...

Time: 6 - 9 pm
( Join us when you can.)

Bring: a potluck dish to share & your own refreshment.

Optional: Bring blanket, bug spray and a flashlight to help guide your exit from the Cemetery, as there is no electrical lighting after dark.

Meeting place: We'll be inside the Main Front Gate (to the right) until 6:15 pm. After 6:15 pm, to locate us, call Chew-Hoong at 781-820-3285 or Mark Hoffman at 617-504-7090.

If weather is iffy & we decide not to attend: email will be sent to you at 4 pm

Admission: FREE, with a $10 suggested donation per lantern. Getting a lantern is optional.

******************************
11th Annual Lantern Festival

Join us for a moving memorial ceremony inspired by Buddhist rituals. Inscribe a lantern with a personal message to friends or family and float it across Lake Hibiscus at sunset.

In this breathtaking ceremony of remembrance, visitors to this lush, Victorian landscape make paper lanterns and set them afloat on the peaceful waters of a small lake. This ritual is based on the traditional Japanese Bon Festival, a time when a door opens to the world of the ancestors, allowing us to send messages to the other side.

People enjoy picnics on the grass and a multi-cultural program of music and dance. They decorate their lanterns with calligraphy and notes to those who have died. At sunset, a candle is lit in each lantern, and the glimmering lanterns are set afloat. Drifting and flickering with the wind, the lanterns symbolize the soulâ€™s journey when life ends.

Enjoy performances by Master Tsuji's Samurai Taiko Drummers, gospel singer Ron Murphy, the Chinese dance of Tsai-Fong Dance Troupe, Quincy Choral Society, traditional Balinese dance by Sanggar Kinanthi, and students from Showa Institute.


Parking is $10; taking the T is encouraged.

Directions: http://www.foresthill...
